context: The Estonian word 'kirjanik' refers to a writer or author of literary works. It comes from the root 'kiri' (writing) with the suffix '-nik' which denotes an occupation or role. The word can refer specifically to creative writers of fiction and literature, as opposed to technical or non-fiction writers. In Estonian grammar, it's a masculine noun that follows specific declension patterns with different cases like genitive (kirjaniku), partitive (kirjanikku), and plural form kirjanikud.
